articles.title: Conversations Gold: Paralympian Christie Dawes is super/normal
articles.description: The Tokyo Paralympics were Christie's seventh as a wheelchair racing competitor, but Christie almost gave up marathons after the 2013 Boston Marathon, and the most frightening experience of her life (CW: mention of suicide) (R)
articles.content:
The Tokyo Paralympics were Christie's seventh as a competitor, and the Paris Games are her first as an expert commentator.

articles.description: The companies racing to build large solar farms across the United States are facing a growing problem: not enough workers. Now, they’re turning to robots for help. Read full story

articles.title: De magazijnier van de toekomst loopt op Belgische wieltjes, dankzij Movu Robotics
articles.description: Twee jaar geleden begon het als “knutselwerk in een garage”, nu veroveren de robots van Movu Robotics in sneltempo de grote magazijnen. “Technology kills jobs? Dat geloof ik niet.”

articles.title: Households look set to avoid more rates pain, but Australia ‘not in any position to cut rates’ ahead of Reserve Bank call: Hogan
articles.description: Independent economist Warren Hogan has argued Australia is "not in any position to cut rates" ahead of the Reserve Bank's meeting on Tuesday, although he backed predictions the bank would opt against another hike.
